recipes.name: Chingri Macher Malaikari
instructions: Marinate the prawns with salt and turmeric
Saute ginger, garlic, and green chili in oil
Add prawns and cook until pink
Add coconut milk and simmer for 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with rice

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
instructions: Peel and chop the potatoes into small pieces
Grind the poppy seeds into a fine paste
Heat mustard oil in a pan and add turmeric
Add the potatoes and fry until slightly brown
Add the poppy seed paste and green chili
Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally
Serve hot with rice

recipes.name: Mutton Kosha
instructions: Marinate the mutton with yogurt, turmeric, and salt
Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add sliced onions
Add ginger and garlic and cook until brown
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft
Add the marinated mutton and pressure cook for 15-20 minutes
Serve hot with paratha

shortBio: Samantha Lee is a classically trained chef with over 10 years of experience in the industry. She specializes in French cuisine and is known for her elegant plating and use of seasonal ingredients.

recipes.name: Bhapa Ilish
instructions: Clean and marinate the hilsa fish with turmeric and salt
Mix mustard paste, coconut, and green chili in a bowl
Place the fish on a plate and cover it with the mustard paste mixture
Steam for 15-20 minutes
Serve hot with rice

recipes.name: Cholar Dal
instructions: Soak the chana dal for 30 minutes
Boil the dal with turmeric and salt
Heat oil in a pan and add bay leaf, cumin seeds, and chopped ginger
Add the boiled dal and cook for 10-15 minutes
Add coconut and cook for another 5 minutes
Serve hot with luchi

recipes.name: Dhokar Dalna
instructions: Soak chana dal for 2-3 hours and grind into a smooth paste
Mix the dal paste with ginger paste, cumin powder, and garam masala
Shape into small cakes and fry until golden brown
Boil potatoes and cut into small pieces
Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions
Add the fried cakes and potatoes and cook for 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with rice

shortBio: Juan Martinez is a chef with a passion for Mexican cuisine. He has worked in several restaurants in both Mexico and the United States, and is known for his flavorful and authentic dishes.

recipes.name: Shorshe Bata Maach
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt
Grind the mustard seeds and green chili into a paste
Heat mustard oil in a pan and add the mustard paste
Add the marinated fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Chholar Ghugni
instructions: Soak yellow peas for 4-5 hours
Boil the peas with salt and turmeric until soft
Cut potatoes into small pieces and fry until slightly brown
Add chopped ginger and grated coconut and cook for 2-3 minutes
Add the boiled peas and cook for 10-15 minutes
Add ghee and serve hot

recipes.name: Macher Jhol
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt
Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onions and chopped ginger
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft
Add cumin powder and water
Add the marinated fish and cook for 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

shortBio: Emily Chang is a chef with a background in pastry. She has worked in several high-end restaurants and is known for her elegant and delicious desserts.

recipes.name: Shukto
instructions: Cut all the vegetables into small pieces
Heat oil in a pan and add panch phoron (Bengali five-spice mix)
Add the vegetables and sauté for 5-7 minutes
Add salt and turmeric and cook for 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Murgir Jhol
instructions: Cut chicken into small pieces
Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onions and chopped ginger
Add chopped tomatoes and green chili and cook until soft
Add the chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes
Add water and salt and simmer for another 10-15 minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
instructions: Boil milk in a pan and simmer for 10-15 minutes
Add sugar and cardamom and stir well
Let it cool down to room temperature
Add yogurt and mix well
Transfer to a clay pot and sprinkle saffron on top
Cover with a lid and leave it to set for 6-8 hours
Serve chilled

shortBio: Tiffany Nguyen is a chef with a passion for Vietnamese cuisine. She grew up cooking with her family and has worked in several Vietnamese restaurants, where she has developed a unique and delicious style of cooking.

recipes.name: Lau Ghanto
instructions: Peel and chop the bottle gourd and potatoes into small pieces
Heat oil in a pan and add panch phoron
Add chopped ginger and green chili and sauté for a minute
Add the chopped vegetables and cook for 5-7 minutes
Add salt, turmeric and water and simmer until the vegetables are cooked
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Bhapa Chingri
instructions: Marinate the prawns with salt and turmeric
Mix mustard paste and coconut milk in a bowl
Add green chili and salt to the mixture
Place the marinated prawns in a bowl and pour the mustard-coconut mixture on top
Cover the bowl with foil and steam for 15-20 minutes
Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Payesh
instructions: Boil rice in water until half-cooked
Drain the water and add milk to the rice
Add sugar and cardamom and simmer until the rice is fully cooked and the milk is thickened
Add raisins and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Serve hot or chilled

shortBio: Andre Williams is a chef with a passion for Southern comfort food. He has worked in several Southern-style restaurants and is known for his flavorful and classic dishes.

recipes.name: Kosha Mangsho
instructions: Cut mutton into small pieces
Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onions
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the onions turn golden brown
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft
Add cumin powder and water and cook until the mutton is tender
Serve hot with steamed rice or paratha

recipes.name: Luchi
instructions: Mix flour, salt, sugar and oil in a bowl
Add water slowly and knead into a soft dough
Cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes
Divide the dough into small balls
Roll each ball into a small circle
Heat oil in a pan and fry the luchis until puffed and golden brown
Serve hot with aloo dum or chholar dal

recipes.name: Rasgulla
instructions: Boil milk in a pan and add lemon juice to curdle the milk
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth
Wash the paneer with cold water to remove the sour taste
Knead the paneer until smooth
Make small balls out of the paneer and keep aside
Boil sugar and water in a pan
Add cardamom and the paneer balls and cook for 10-15 minutes
Let it cool down and serve chilled

shortBio: Maria Hernandez is a chef with a passion for Spanish cuisine. She has worked in several restaurants in Spain and the United States, and is known for her flavorful and authentic dishes.
